alert.note: Alert for Brazos; Burleson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 9:27PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...A thunderstorm prompting a severe thunderstorm warning in Milam and Roberston counties is approaching Brazos and Burleson counties... At 923 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a severe thunderstorm 7 miles east of Cameron, moving southeast at 25 mph. This storm is slowly weakening as it approaches Brazos and Burleson counties, but is currently still severe as it cross Milam and Robertson counties. HAZARD...The NWS Office in Fort Worth has issued a severe thunderstorm warning for wind gusts of 65 mph and hail to golf ball size in Milam and Robertson counties. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects and large hail could cause damage. Locations impacted include... Bryan, Caldwell, Bryan Utilities Lake, Deanville and Chriesman. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may still be severe when it enters Burleson and Brazos counties, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
